intro: Pinalia bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored pincushion cactus, is a unique succulent native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and its striking, bi-colored flowers that range from white to pink. The plant features spiny stems covered in dense, woolly hairs that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. Its leaves are reduced to small, scale-like structures, typical of many cacti, and it produces small, fleshy fruits after flowering. Pinalia bicolor is adapted to survive in extreme drought conditions, making it a resilient and fascinating species in the botanical world.
